from itertools import accumulate
I=input; R=lambda:map(int,I().split())
n,q=R(); a=sorted(R())[::-1]; p=[0]+list(accumulate(a))
for _ in range(q): x,y=R(); print(p[x]-p[x-y]) Yes. So the missing code is the line 'for _ in range(q):' which loops q times, handling each query.
